questions.text: Who was the Supreme Being of the ancient Filipinos who, they believed, had created the universe?
What is considered the earliest form of writing in the Philippines?
What province was in the earlier times became known far and wide as the 'provincia de Comintang'?

Marriage among the Filipinos in the past was long and complicated. You had to render services to the prospective bride's family, for example, by chopping wood or fetching water from a 'balon' for days or months or years! If you were lucky enough to be accepted, what did you call of the gift you were required to give to the girl's parents?
The Spanish-American War brought an end to Spanish rule. In May 1898, the Americans, under Commodore George Dewey won "The Battle of ______ ______".
The Tejeros Convention happened in which Philippine province?

Filipinos remembered Dr. Jose Rizal as the patriot of the masses. He was executed by the Spanish authorities in Luneta (Bagumbayan by then), Manila in December 30, 1896. What capital punishment was used to execute him?
Andres Bonifacio talked personally to Rizal during the later's exile in Dapitan. Yes/No
July 1892: La Liga Filipina (Spanish for "The Philippine League") was established by who in Tondo, Manila.

Jose Rizal and other Illustrados (Spanish for Filipino intellectuals) had established this group of propaganda writers. The name of this progressive society newspaper against Spain was _______________.
Name the priests that were executed by Governor-General Rafael de Izuquierdo in 1872.
In 1762-1763 the most popular revolt took place in Ilocos. Diego and Gabriela Silang had defended Ilocos from the Spanish authorities. Identify the relationship of the Silangs.
Which one of these Philippine revolts during the Hispanic period lasted longest?
For how many years did Spanish rule last in the Philippines? Clue: 3 digits.
The Hispanic Period had started in the Philippines in 1500s. Who was the first Governor of the Philippines?
In 1851, the first commercial bank in the Philippines and the far East, was established. What is the present name of this bank?
He arrived in Cebu in 1565 to establish the first Spanish settlement in the Philippines, marking the beginning of Spain's colonization and Christianization of the archipelago. Who was he?
What is the first word of the 1987 Philippine Constitution?
Where was the Rizal's novel 'Noli Mi Tangere' published? Clue: European Capital
Who is generally acknowledged as the first President of the Philippines?
One of the last Filipino generals who fought the Americans and established the so-called 'Tagalog Republic'.
What act is also known as the "Martial Law" act? Clue: Proclamation ____
What place in the Philippines is also known as the "walled city"?
From which language is the Filipino vernacular largely derived?
On 1901, an institution was established by the Americans for aspiring educators. What is the present name of this institution?
Which of these was a US president during the 'American Era' in the Philippines?
What term was used for those women who were used by Japanese soldiers to gratify their lust?
The first political party in the Philippines organized on December 23, 1900 by wealthy Filipino illustrados.
Who was the chief advisor of Gen. Emilio Aguinaldo?
She was the first woman member of the Katipunan (July 1893).
This late lawyer-politician from Ilocos had served two Republics, and the longest seated President of the Philippines. His name was _____________________.
------ ----- became the last Commonwealth President before the Philippines gained independence from United States.
Who won the first Philippine National Presidential Election?
